subject: Basketball
Women
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: After an absence of nearly four years, the Connecticut women’s basketball team is back at No. 1 in the rankings. The Huskies received 49 of the 50 first-place votes in the Associated Press poll after being No. 2 all season. Tennessee had been No. 1 since the preseason poll, but lost to Stanford, 73-69, in overtime Saturday night.The Lady Vols fell to No. 3. Stanford received the other first-place vote, moving to No. 2 from No. 5.Connecticut last held the top spot Feb. 23, 2004. The time away from the top ranking was the longest drought in Coach Geno Auriemma’s career, since Connecticut first reached No. 1 on Jan. 17, 1995. Connecticut has now held the top spot 95 times. Only Tennessee has held it more. The Huskies (9-0) have been winning by an average of 40 points this season.
